Are you looking for the perfect hairstyle that flatters your oblong face and high forehead? You've come to the right place. In this article, we'll explore different hairstyles that complement your face shape and provide tips on how to care for your hair.

Table of Contents

  • Understanding Your Face Shape
  • Hairstyles for Oblong Face High Forehead
  • Tips for Styling Your Hair
  • FAQs
  • Hair Care for Oblong Face High Forehead

Understanding Your Face Shape

Before diving into hairstyles, it's important to understand your face shape. Oblong faces are longer than they are wide, with a high forehead and a prominent chin. You may also have a slightly pointed jawline.

The key to finding the right hairstyle is to balance out your face shape. This means adding width to the sides of your face and minimizing the length of your forehead.

Hairstyles for Oblong Face High Forehead

Now that you know your face shape, let's explore different hairstyles that complement your features.

1. Bangs

Bangs are a great way to minimize the appearance of a high forehead. Side-swept bangs or blunt bangs that hit just above the eyebrows are both flattering options.

2. Layered Bob

A layered bob adds volume and width to the sides of your face, balancing out an oblong shape. It's also easy to maintain and style.

3. Long Layers

If you prefer longer hair, opt for long layers that frame your face and soften your jawline. This style works best with loose waves or curls.

4. Pixie Cut

A pixie cut with layers and texture can add volume to the crown of your head, making your face appear shorter. This style is also low-maintenance and edgy.

5. Updos

Updos such as buns or braids can create the illusion of a shorter forehead while still showcasing your length. Avoid slicked-back styles, which can elongate your face even more.

Tips for Styling Your Hair

Now that you have some hairstyle ideas, here are some tips to help you style your hair.

1. Use Products

Products such as mousse or volumizing spray can add texture and lift to your hair, making it appear fuller and wider. Avoid heavy, oily products that can weigh down your hair.

2. Experiment with Parting

Changing your part can create the illusion of a different face shape. If you usually part your hair in the middle, try a side part to add width to your face.

3. Embrace Your Natural Texture

Working with your natural texture can make styling easier and more flattering. If you have curly hair, embrace the curls with a layered cut. If you have straight hair, add volume with a textured bob.

FAQs

What hairstyles should I avoid if I have an oblong face and high forehead?

Avoid hairstyles that add height to the crown of your head, such as high ponytails or backcombing. Also, avoid straight, blunt cuts that can elongate your face even more.

Can I still wear my hair in a middle part?

While a middle part can elongate your face, it's still possible to make it work. Try adding side-swept bangs or layers to add width to your face.

Hair Care for Oblong Face High Forehead

Caring for your hair is just as important as styling it. Here are some tips to keep your hair healthy and strong.

1. Use Heat Protectant

When using heat tools such as a straightener or curling iron, always use a heat protectant to prevent damage to your hair.

2. Trim Regularly

Regular trims can prevent split ends and keep your hair looking healthy. Aim for a trim every 6-8 weeks.

3. Avoid Over-Washing

Washing your hair too frequently can strip it of its natural oils, leading to dryness and damage. Aim to wash your hair every 2-3 days, or use dry shampoo in between washes.

With these tips and hairstyle ideas, you can find the perfect look for your oblong face and high forehead. Remember to embrace your natural features and have fun experimenting with different styles!

How to Make Men's Hair More Silky | Tips, Steps, and FAQ

Do you want to achieve silky, smooth hair as a man? You're not alone! Many men struggle with dry, frizzy hair that lacks shine and silkiness. Fortunately, achieving silky hair is possible with the right hair care routine. In this article, we'll share tips, steps, and answer frequently asked questions on how to make men's hair more silky.

How to Make Men's Hair More Silky: How-To Guide

Before we dive into the steps, let's discuss some essential tips to achieve silky, smooth hair:

1. Use a Gentle Shampoo

Harsh shampoos can strip your hair of natural oils, causing dryness and frizziness. Use a gentle shampoo that's suitable for your hair type and texture.

2. Condition Your Hair

Conditioning your hair after shampooing helps to moisturize and detangle your hair. Use a conditioner that's suitable for your hair type and texture.

3. Use a Leave-In Conditioner

Leave-in conditioners help to hydrate your hair and protect it from damage. Apply a leave-in conditioner to your hair after showering, and don't rinse it out.

4. Avoid Using Hot Tools

Hot tools like blow dryers, straighteners, and curling irons can damage your hair and cause dryness and frizziness. Avoid using hot tools or use them sparingly.

5. Eat a Healthy Diet

Your diet can affect the health of your hair. Eat a balanced diet that's rich in protein, vitamins, and minerals to support healthy hair growth.

6. Stay Hydrated

Drink plenty of water to keep your hair and scalp hydrated. Dehydration can cause dryness and damage to your hair.

Steps to Make Men's Hair More Silky

Now that you know the essential tips let's dive into the steps to make men's hair more silky:

Step 1: Wash Your Hair

Start by washing your hair with a gentle shampoo. Massage the shampoo into your scalp, and rinse thoroughly with water.

Step 2: Apply Conditioner

Apply a conditioner to your hair after shampooing. Focus on the ends of your hair, and leave the conditioner on for a few minutes before rinsing it out.

Step 3: Apply Leave-In Conditioner

Apply a leave-in conditioner to your hair after showering. Use a small amount and distribute it evenly throughout your hair.

Step 4: Air Dry Your Hair

Avoid using hot tools to dry your hair. Instead, gently pat your hair with a towel, and let it air dry.

Step 5: Apply Hair Oil

Apply a hair oil to your hair to add shine and silkiness. Use a small amount and distribute it evenly throughout your hair.

Tips for Maintaining Silky Hair

Here are some tips for maintaining silky, smooth hair:

1. Avoid Over-Washing Your Hair

Washing your hair too often can strip it of natural oils, causing dryness and damage. Wash your hair every two to three days or as needed.

2. Use a Silk Pillowcase

Sleeping on a silk pillowcase can help to reduce friction and damage to your hair.

3. Trim Your Hair Regularly

Trimming your hair regularly can help to prevent split ends and breakage. Visit a hair salon every six to eight weeks for a trim.

FAQ: How to Make Men's Hair More Silky

Q: Can I use hair masks to make my hair more silky?

A: Yes, hair masks can help to hydrate and nourish your hair, making it more silky and smooth. Use a hair mask once a week or as needed.

Q: Can I use hair serums to make my hair more silky?

A: Yes, hair serums can add shine and silkiness to your hair. Use a small amount and distribute it evenly throughout your hair.

Q: Can I use coconut oil to make my hair more silky?

A: Yes, coconut oil can help to hydrate and nourish your hair, making it more silky and smooth. Apply a small amount of coconut oil to your hair, and leave it on for a few hours or overnight before washing it out.

Hair Care for Silky Hair

Now that you know how to make men's hair more silky let's discuss some hair care tips to maintain silky hair:

1. Avoid Chemical Treatments

Chemical treatments like perms, relaxers, and color treatments can damage your hair and cause dryness and frizziness. Avoid chemical treatments or use them sparingly.

2. Protect Your Hair from Sun Damage

Exposure to the sun can damage your hair, causing dryness and breakage. Wear a hat or use a hair product with SPF protection to protect your hair from the sun.

3. Use a Wide-Tooth Comb

Using a wide-tooth comb can help to prevent breakage and damage to your hair. Use a wide-tooth comb to detangle your hair, starting from the ends and working your way up to the roots.

By following these tips and steps, you can achieve silky, smooth hair as a man. Remember to be patient and consistent with your hair care routine, and your hair will thank you for it.

If you're thinking about getting bangs but aren't sure what style will suit your face shape, you're not alone. With so many options to choose from, it can be overwhelming to figure out what kind of bangs for your face shape will flatter your features best. But don't worry – in this guide, we'll break down the different types of bangs and help you find the perfect match for your face shape.

Table of Contents

  • Face Shapes
  • Types of Bangs
  • How to Choose the Right Bangs for Your Face Shape
  • Tips for Styling Your Bangs
  • FAQs
  • Hair Care Tips for Bangs

Face Shapes

Before we dive into the different types of bangs, let's first identify your face shape. There are six main face shapes:

  • Round
  • Oval
  • Square
  • Heart
  • Diamond
  • Long

Take a look at yourself in the mirror and determine which shape best describes your face. Once you know your face shape, you can use this guide to find the right bangs for your features.

Types of Bangs

There are several types of bangs to choose from, including:

  • Straight Across Bangs
  • Side-Swept Bangs
  • Curly Bangs
  • Blunt Bangs
  • Wispy Bangs
  • Tapered Bangs
  • Micro Bangs

Each of these styles can be customized to suit your face shape and personal preferences. Let's take a look at which bangs work best for each face shape.

How to Choose the Right Bangs for Your Face Shape

Round Face

If you have a round face, you want to avoid bangs that are too short or too blunt. Instead, opt for side-swept bangs that angle down towards the cheekbones. This will help elongate your face and create a more balanced look.

Oval Face

Lucky you – oval faces can pull off just about any type of bangs! Consider trying straight across bangs for a dramatic look, or side-swept bangs to add some softness to your features.

Square Face

Soft, rounder bangs work best for square faces. Try wispy or tapered bangs that curve around the forehead and blend in with the rest of your hair. Avoid blunt or straight across bangs, as they can make your face appear too boxy.

Heart Face

If you have a heart-shaped face, you want to balance out your features by drawing attention away from the forehead. Side-swept bangs are perfect for this, as they create a diagonal line that flatters the face. Avoid blunt or straight across bangs, which can make the forehead appear larger.

Diamond Face

Diamond faces are characterized by high cheekbones and a narrow forehead. To balance out your features, try side-swept bangs that angle downwards towards the middle of your face. Avoid blunt or heavy bangs, which can make your face appear too top-heavy.

Long Face

If you have a long face, you want to avoid bangs that are too short or too blunt. Instead, try side-swept bangs that angle downwards towards the cheekbones. This will help create the illusion of a shorter face.

Tips for Styling Your Bangs

Once you've found the perfect bangs for your face shape, it's important to know how to style them. Here are a few tips:

  • Blow dry your bangs with a round brush to create volume and shape.
  • Use a flat iron to smooth out any kinks or cowlicks.
  • Trim your bangs every 4-6 weeks to keep them looking fresh.
  • Experiment with different parting styles to find what looks best on you.

FAQs

Can I pull off bangs if I have curly hair?

Absolutely! Curly bangs can look amazing on the right person. Just make sure to choose a style that complements your face shape and hair texture.

Can I cut my own bangs?

We don't recommend it. Cutting bangs requires a certain level of skill and precision. It's best to leave it to a professional stylist.

What if I don't like my bangs?

Don't worry – bangs grow out! If you're not happy with your new fringe, talk to your stylist about options for growing them out or changing the style.

Hair Care Tips for Bangs

Now that you have your perfect bangs, it's important to take care of them. Here are a few hair care tips:

  • Wash your bangs every 2-3 days to keep them looking fresh.
  • Use a dry shampoo between washes to keep your bangs from getting greasy.
  • Avoid touching your bangs too much, as oils from your hands can make them look greasy.
  • Trim your bangs every 4-6 weeks to keep them looking neat.

With these tips and tricks, you'll be able to find the perfect bangs for your face shape and rock them with confidence. Happy styling!

item.title: Does Cutting Your Hair Short Make It Look Thicker

If you've ever felt like your hair is thin and lifeless, you've probably wondered if cutting it short could help. After all, shorter hair looks fuller, right? But does cutting your hair short actually make it look thicker? In this article, we'll explore the answer to that question and provide tips for getting the most out of short haircuts.

Table of Contents

  • How to Cut Your Hair Short to Make It Look Thicker
  • Step-by-Step Guide for Cutting Your Hair Short
  • Tips for Maintaining Thicker-Looking Short Hair
  • FAQ: Answering Common Questions About Short Haircuts and Hair Thickness
  • Hair Care Tips for Thicker-Looking Short Hair

How to Cut Your Hair Short to Make It Look Thicker

The short answer to this question is yes, cutting your hair short can make it look thicker. When you have long hair, the weight of the hair can pull it down and make it look limp and lifeless. Cutting off some length can help to make it look fuller and more voluminous.

However, the key to making your hair look thicker with a short haircut is to choose the right style. Some short haircuts can actually make your hair look even thinner, so it's important to consult with a stylist who can recommend the best cut for your hair type and face shape.

Best Short Haircuts for Thicker-Looking Hair

Some of the best short haircuts for making your hair look thicker include:

  • Pixie cuts
  • Bobs
  • Layered cuts
  • Cropped cuts

These haircuts work by removing some of the weight from your hair and adding layers that create movement and texture. This can make your hair look fuller and more voluminous, especially if you have thin or fine hair.

Step-by-Step Guide for Cutting Your Hair Short

If you're ready to take the plunge and cut your hair short, here's a step-by-step guide to help you get started:

  1. Consult with a stylist to determine the best short haircut for your hair type and face shape.
  2. Wash and dry your hair thoroughly.
  3. Section your hair into four parts using clips or hair ties.
  4. Starting at the nape of your neck, use shears to cut your hair to the desired length.
  5. Continue cutting the rest of your hair, section by section.
  6. Create layers by holding your hair at a 45-degree angle and making short, snipping cuts.
  7. Blend the layers together by using shears to create texture.
  8. Style your hair as desired using a blow dryer, straightener, or curling iron.

Tips for Maintaining Thicker-Looking Short Hair

Once you've cut your hair short, there are a few things you can do to maintain a fuller, thicker look:

  • Use volumizing shampoo and conditioner to give your hair body and lift.
  • Blow dry your hair upside down to add volume at the roots.
  • Use a texturizing spray to add movement and texture to your hair.
  • Avoid using heavy styling products that can weigh down your hair.

FAQ: Answering Common Questions About Short Haircuts and Hair Thickness

Will cutting my hair short make it grow thicker?

No, cutting your hair short will not change the thickness of your hair. Hair thickness is determined by genetics and cannot be altered by cutting your hair.

Can I still have long hair if I want my hair to look thicker?

Yes, you can still have long hair and make it look thicker by getting regular trims to remove split ends and using volumizing products to add body and lift.

What should I do if I don't like my short haircut?

If you don't like your short haircut, don't worry! Hair grows back, and you can always try a different style in the meantime. Consult with your stylist to see if there are any adjustments that can be made to improve the look of your haircut.

Hair Care Tips for Thicker-Looking Short Hair

In addition to using the tips and techniques outlined above, there are a few other things you can do to keep your hair looking its best:

  • Avoid over-washing your hair, as this can strip it of its natural oils and make it look dull and lifeless.
  • Use a wide-toothed comb or your fingers to detangle your hair, as brushing can cause breakage and damage.
  • Protect your hair from heat damage by using a heat protectant spray before using hot tools.
  • Get regular trims to keep your hair healthy and prevent split ends.

By following these tips and getting the right short haircut for your hair type and face shape, you can achieve a fuller, thicker look that will have you feeling confident and stylish.

Description

Permed hair is hair that has been chemically treated to create curls or waves. Cutting short permed hair involves cutting the hair to a shorter length while still maintaining the permed texture. How to Cut Short Permed Hair

  • Sharp scissors
  • Comb
  • Clips

Step-by-Step Guide

Follow these steps to cut your short permed hair:

  1. Wash and dry your hair.
  2. Divide your hair into sections and clip each section to keep it out of the way.
  3. Start at the back of your head and work your way forward. Take a section of hair and comb it straight out from your head.
  4. Hold the hair between your fingers where you want to cut it. Use your scissors to cut the hair in a straight line.
  5. Move on to the next section of hair and repeat the process, keeping the length consistent.
  6. Once you've cut all the sections, check your hair in the mirror to make sure it's even.

Tips for Cutting Short Permed Hair

  • Use sharp scissors to avoid split ends or damaged hair.
  • Take your time and cut small sections at a time to avoid mistakes.
  • Check your hair in the mirror frequently to make sure it's even.
  • Don't cut too much hair at once; it's better to cut a little bit at a time and adjust as needed.

Can I cut my short permed hair at home?

Yes, you can cut your short permed hair at home, but it's important to follow the proper technique to avoid damaging your hair.

How often should I cut my short permed hair?

You should cut your short permed hair every 6-8 weeks to keep it looking healthy and to prevent split ends.

Should I cut my hair wet or dry?

It's best to cut your hair dry to get a better idea of how it will look once it's cut.

Hair Care Tips for Short Permed Hair

Here are some tips to keep your short permed hair healthy and looking great:

Cats can have an allergic reaction to flea bites, which can cause intense itching, redness, and bald spots. If you suspect that your cat has flea allergy dermatitis, check for fleas and flea dirt in your cat's fur. You may also notice scabs, bumps, or open sores on your cat's skin.

Ringworm

Ringworm is a fungal infection that can cause circular bald patches on your cat's skin. The skin around the bald spot may be red, scaly, or crusty. Ringworm is highly contagious and can be spread to other pets and humans.

Ear Mites

Ear mites are tiny parasites that can live in your cat's ears and cause intense itching and scratching. Your cat may scratch its ears so much that it develops a bald spot on its head.

Your cat may have accidentally scratched or injured its head, causing a bald spot. If the skin around the bald spot is red, swollen, or bleeding, your cat may need medical attention.

Flea Allergy Dermatitis

Ringworm

Ear Mites

Start by washing and towel-drying your hair. Comb it out so it's tangle-free and easy to work with. If you have longer hair, you may want to trim it down with scissors before starting with the clippers.

Continue working your way down with progressively shorter guards (like a #2 or #3, then a #1 or #2) until you've reached the desired length for the fade. Remember to keep the lines slightly curved to create a natural-looking transition.

Blending Your Hair

To blend the different lengths of your hair, switch to a shorter guard (like a #1) and use an upward flicking motion with the clippers to create a fade between the two lengths. Start at the bottom and work your way up, using different guards as needed to create a smooth transition.

You may also want to use your barber shears to blend any areas that need extra attention. Use the comb to lift the hair up and cut off any longer pieces that are sticking out.

Cleaning Up Your Cut

Once you've finished the fade, use the clippers to trim any stray hairs around your ears and neck. Use the regular mirror to check the back of your head and make any final adjustments.

When you're done, use the handheld mirror to check your new haircut from all angles. If you're happy with it, give yourself a pat on the back!

Yes, you can! It may take some practice, but with the right tools and technique, you can achieve a great-looking fade haircut at home.

What's the difference between a fade and a taper?

A fade is a gradual transition from longer to shorter hair, while a taper is a gradual transition from shorter to longer hair. Fades typically start higher up on the head and are shorter overall.

Do I need to wash my hair before cutting it?

It's a good idea to wash and towel-dry your hair before cutting it. This will make it easier to work with and help you achieve a more even cut.

item.title: Why Is My Cat Losing Fur Around His Tail
item.description:
If you've noticed that your cat is losing fur around his tail, you may be wondering what the cause could be. In this article, we'll explore some of the common reasons why cats lose fur around their tails, how to diagnose the issue, and what you can do to help your cat.

Description

Cats are known for their beautiful and soft fur, but sometimes they may experience hair loss around their tail. Hair loss, also known as alopecia, can happen for various reasons, including stress, allergies, parasites, infections, hormonal imbalances, and more. It's essential to identify the root cause to provide the right treatment and prevent further complications.

How to Diagnose

If you're unsure why your cat is losing fur around his tail, it's best to take him to a veterinarian. The vet will perform a physical examination, ask about your cat's medical history, and may also conduct some tests, such as a skin scrape, blood work, or fungal culture, to rule out any underlying conditions. Based on the diagnosis, the vet will recommend the appropriate course of action.

Step by Step Guide

Step 1: Observe your Cat's Behavior

Pay attention to your cat's behavior and see if there are any changes that could suggest a problem. Is your cat scratching or biting his tail? Is he grooming excessively or avoiding certain areas? These signs could indicate an underlying issue.

Step 2: Inspect the Affected Area

Take a closer look at the fur around your cat's tail. Is the skin red, inflamed, or scabbed? Are there any bumps, lumps, or lesions? These symptoms could indicate an infection, allergy, or parasite infestation.

Step 3: Schedule a Vet Appointment

If you notice any signs of hair loss or skin problems, take your cat to a vet. The vet will examine your cat and may perform some tests, such as a skin scrape or blood work, to identify the cause of the problem.

Tips

  • Keep your cat's environment clean and free of parasites.
  • Feed your cat a balanced and nutritious diet to support healthy skin and fur.
  • Provide your cat with plenty of water and encourage him to stay hydrated.
  • Use a flea comb to remove any fleas or ticks from your cat's fur.
  • Avoid using harsh chemicals or shampoos on your cat's skin or fur.

FAQ

Q: Can stress cause hair loss in cats?

A: Yes, stress can be a significant factor in hair loss in cats. Cats can experience stress due to various reasons, including changes in their environment, new pets or people, loud noises, or illness. Stress can weaken the immune system and lead to skin problems and hair loss.

Q: Can allergies cause hair loss in cats?

A: Yes, allergies can cause hair loss in cats. Cats can be allergic to various things, including certain foods, pollen, dust mites, and flea bites. Allergies can lead to itchiness, inflammation, and hair loss.

Hair Care

Regular grooming and hair care can help prevent hair loss in cats. Brush your cat's fur regularly to remove any loose hair and distribute natural oils that keep the skin and fur healthy. Use a cat-specific shampoo and conditioner to keep your cat's fur clean and soft. Avoid using products that contain harsh chemicals or fragrances that can irritate the skin or cause an allergic reaction.

In conclusion, hair loss around a cat's tail can be a sign of an underlying issue that needs to be identified and treated. By observing your cat's behavior, inspecting the affected area, and taking your cat to a vet, you can help your cat recover his beautiful fur and stay healthy and happy.

item.title: Would You Look Good With Short Hair How To Decide
item.description:
Short hair is a bold and trendy style that can transform your look. However, deciding whether or not to cut your hair can be a daunting task. In this article, we will explore how to determine if short hair is right for you and provide tips on how to care for your new style.

Description

Short hair can be a liberating and refreshing change for many people. It can accentuate your facial features and give you a youthful appearance. However, it’s important to consider your face shape, hair texture, and personal style before making the big chop.

How to Decide

Before deciding to cut your hair, consider the following factors:

Face Shape

Your face shape is an important factor when deciding on a haircut. Short hair can look great on oval, heart-shaped, and square faces. However, if you have a round or long face, a longer haircut may be more flattering.

Hair Texture

Your hair texture can also affect how your short haircut looks. If you have fine, straight hair, a short bob or pixie cut can add volume and dimension. If you have thick, curly hair, a short cut can be difficult to manage and may require more styling time.

Personal Style

Your personal style should also be taken into consideration when deciding on a haircut. If you prefer a more edgy or modern look, a short haircut may be perfect for you. However, if you prefer a more classic or conservative style, a longer haircut may be a better fit.

Step by Step

If you’ve decided to take the plunge and cut your hair short, follow these steps:

1. Find Inspiration

Look for inspiration photos of short haircuts that you like. Consider the length, texture, and style of the cuts that catch your eye.

2. Consult with a Stylist

Visit a reputable stylist and discuss your desired haircut. They can provide insight on what styles will look best on you based on your face shape and hair texture.

3. Prepare Your Hair

Before your appointment, make sure to wash and dry your hair. This will make it easier for your stylist to work with and will ensure a more accurate cut.

4. Cut Your Hair

Trust your stylist and let them work their magic. Make sure to communicate any concerns or preferences during the process.

5. Style Your Hair

After your haircut, your stylist can show you how to style your new look. Ask for tips on how to maintain your style at home.

Tips

Here are some tips to help you care for your short hair:

1. Use the Right Products

Use products that are specifically designed for your hair type and style. This can help enhance your natural texture and prevent damage.

2. Protect Your Hair

Use heat protectant products before using styling tools and avoid using excessive heat. This can help prevent damage and breakage.

3. Get Regular Trims

Short haircuts require more frequent trims to maintain their shape and prevent split ends. Schedule regular appointments with your stylist.

FAQ

1. Will short hair make me look older?

No, short hair can actually give you a more youthful appearance by accentuating your facial features.

2. Will short hair work with my hair texture?

Short hair can work with any hair texture, but it’s important to choose a style that will work with your natural texture.

3. Will short hair be difficult to style?

Short hair can be easier to style than longer hair because there is less hair to work with. However, it may require more frequent styling to maintain its shape.

Hair Care

Proper hair care is essential to maintaining healthy and beautiful hair. Here are some tips for caring for your short hair:

1. Wash Your Hair Regularly

Wash your hair every 2-3 days with a gentle shampoo and conditioner.

2. Use a Wide-Tooth Comb

Use a wide-tooth comb to detangle your hair, starting at the ends and working your way up to the roots.

3. Protect Your Hair from the Sun

Protect your hair from the sun by wearing a hat or using a UV protectant spray.

4. Avoid Excessive Heat

Avoid using excessive heat on your hair, such as blow dryers and flat irons, as this can cause damage and breakage.

By following these tips and taking the time to consider whether short hair is right for you, you can achieve a bold and beautiful new look that enhances your natural beauty.
